goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of stars for the repositories?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the popularity of the repositories based on the number of stars they have received.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of forks for the repositories?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the popularity of the repositories based on the number of forks they have received.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of watchers for the repositories?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the popularity of the repositories based on the number of watchers they have received.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of commits for the repositories?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the level of activity in the repositories based on the number of commits made.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of contributors for the repositories?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the level of collaboration in the repositories based on the number of contributors involved.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.hist(data['stars'], bins=50, color='blue', alpha=0.7)
    plt.axvline(data['stars'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['stars'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Number of Stars')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of stars for the repositories?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.hist(data['forks'], bins=30, color='blue', alpha=0.7)
    plt.axvline(data['forks'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['forks'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Number of Forks')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of forks for the repositories?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.hist(data['watchers'], bins=30, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='Watchers')
    plt.axvline(data['watchers'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['watchers'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Number of Watchers')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of watchers for the repositories?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['commits'] = pd.to_numeric(data['commits'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['commits'])]
    
    plt.hist(data['commits'], bins=30, color='blue', alpha=0.7)
    plt.axvline(data['commits'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['commits'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Number of Commits')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of commits for the repositories?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.hist(data['contributors'], bins=20, color='blue', alpha=0.7)
    plt.axvline(data['contributors'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['contributors'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Number of Contributors')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of contributors for the repositories?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
